properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 1 at 12:15PM AKST until March 1 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 45 below occurring. The cold
wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to
exposed skin.

* WHERE...Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula.

* WHEN....until 4pm today.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions will become less extreme late this
afternoon as winds decrease.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED
